newsitem.title: USA: GM sets truck agreement for Namibia.
newsitem.headline: GM sets truck agreement for Namibia.

text.p: General Motors Corp said its General Motors Overseas Distribution Corp reached an agreement with Quigley Motor Co to convert Chevrolet C/K full-size pick-up trucks to right hand drive for Namibia, Africa.
The Namibian government has placed an order for more than 800 GM vehicles, the companies said. Total project investment is approximately $30 million.
More than 700 GM C/K pickup trucks will be produced in North America and converted to right hand drive. Maintenance and repair of the vehicles will take place in Namibia.

About one-third of the trucks will be converted to right drive at Quigley's North American Operation in Manchester, Pa. The remaining trucks will be converted to right hand drive in Namibia from material kits and technology supplied by Quigley.

Conversion will be done at a new Barden International facility to be constructed in Namibia and completed this fall. When fully operational, the Namibian facility will employ 70 full-time local workers.
Barden is a GM dealer for Namibia.
